intro: Nassauvia capillata, commonly known as the silky nassauvia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its delicate, feathery foliage and clusters of pale yellow to white blooms make it an ornamental plant in arid landscapes. Nassauvia capillata is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, benefiting surrounding vegetation.
